column3: What is actually failing with `-Werror=unused-variable`? I can build depends and configure master (76e777df83db4fc14d5cf96c67ceaa554a016a3a) with `--enable-werror` and I'm not seeing any issues.
@fanquake It depends on what libraries your system comes with. E.g. it fails when your system ships a "broken" boost: https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/613924094#L10291

@MarcoFalke Right, but that failure isn't using system Boost, it's building Boost from depends. So are we assuming that builds for people using `master` and system libraries are also currently failing when using `--enable-werror`? It would be good to get some examples.\n\nThe problem this PR is "fixing", which is unclear from the description, is that 15382 introduces a dependency on Boost Proces
I'd presume that this also fails when a system library is broken, but I haven't checked.

In my experience it only failed on a PR that started using a previously unused part of Boost #15382. We could of course leave this PR open until it actually breaks something on Travis. Maybe #14920 is merged before that's needed.

> Right, but that failure isn't using system Boost, it's building Boost from depends.

I can also produce that failure with system Boost in that PR, but only 1.7

### Gitian builds | File | commit 2c1c43754b7a29e2fc852c2ad6430ba27aa2d7db
(master) | commit bd6dd0572facc8af3e4e3209572540a275c1cf82
(master and this pull) | |--|--|--| | bitcoin-0.19.99-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz | [`38cbfb45b6a7086d...`](https://drahtbot.space/gitian/bitcoin/bitcoin/2c1c43754b7a29e2fc852c2ad6430ba27aa2d7db/bitcoin-0.19.99-

Going to close this. If this change is required by a PR (#15382), it should be included in that PR (looks like it is), rather than applied to the build system in advance. Also see my comment above; https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17533#issuecomment-556092676. #15382 could also be taking other approaches, like at least patching boost process in depends, rather than reverting a good, project
